Chair of the Senate was a position in the Galactic Senate of the Galactic Republic. A duty tasked to the individual in the role was to meet with representatives of Republic member worlds in a committee. The committee was meant to discuss problems the world faced, but they did not always get to a resolution.

Sometime prior to becoming the Vice Chancellor of the Republic, the Chagrian Mas Amedda severed as the chair of the Senate. At some point during his time in the position, Amedda met with representatives of the Outer Rim planet Vallt in a committee. The world did not receive much trade or respect from the Republic, as well as lacking fair representation in the government. However, when the representatives informed Amedda that they had been ignored, Amedda and the committee did not work to help the planet. Instead, Amedda became annoyed with Vallt, viewing them as a disaffected group.

During the time of Chancellor Finis Valorum, Amedda won the position of Vice Chancellor, which he continued to hold this position into the chancellery of Sheev Palpatine and the Clone Wars. Around a year into the war,[source?] Vallt became part of the Confederacy of Independent Systems, which promised the fair representation, trade, and respect it had never gotten from the Republic. After Lieutenant Commander Orson Krennic informed Amedda that the scientist Galen Erso was on Vallt and could be used to complete a secret project, Amedda showed annoyance at the mention of Vallt, and recounted his experience with the planet from his time as chair of the Senate.

The title of chair of the Senate was first mentioned in canon in the 2016 novel Catalyst: A Rogue One Novel by James Luceno. The Chair of the Senate originated in the 1996 Star Wars Legends novel Before the Storm by Michael P. Kube-McDowell.
